evidence.text: COUNT TWO Administrative Procedure Act, 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A) (All Defendants)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: a. Declare the defunding of the CFPB to be arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law under 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A) and 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(C);

extracted.value: Declaratory judgment that the defunding of the CFPB is arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law under 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A) and 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(C)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: b. Temporarily, preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants and all of their officers, employees, and agents from taking any steps to unilaterally defund the CFPB, including transferring the Bureau’s reserve funds or otherwise using them for a purpose other than the operation of the Bureau;

extracted.value: Injunction (preliminary, permanent and temporary) to enjoin defendants from unilaterally defunding the CFPB, including transferring reserve funds or using them for non‑operations

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: c. Set aside and hold unlawful the defunding decision;

extracted.value: Set aside and hold unlawful the defunding decision

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: d. Award Plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney’s fees, and other disbursements as appropriate;

extracted.value: Award plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney’s fees, and other disbursements as appropriate

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: e. Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.

extracted.value: Grant other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper
